channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: France's prime minister resigns after less than a month in office
item.description: Facing criticism from all sides, France's new prime minister Sébastien Lecornu resigned less than 24 hours after naming his government and after less ...

item.title: Judge blocks deployment of National Guard to Oregon. And, the Supreme Court's new term
item.description: A judge issues an order to stop Trump's latest attempt to deploy the National Guard to Oregon. And, the Supreme Court opens a new term with justices t...

item.title: The medicine Nobel Prize goes to 3 scientists for work on peripheral immune tolerance
item.description: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi were honored for research into how the body helps the immune system avoid attacking your own tissu...

item.title: A bold doctor sent her kids away and helped beat one of the world's deadliest viruses
item.description: A year ago, Rwanda faced its first outbreak of Marburg virus. Dr. Tsion Firew remembers how scared she was — and how that didn't stop her from playing...

item.title: How one country has become a top destination for hair transplants
item.description: With more than 1 million people going to Turkey for the procedure every year, hair transplants are transforming men's scalps — and vanity. But not eve...

item.title: Sudan militia leader convicted of war crimes during Darfur war
item.description: Ali Kushayb led the Janjaweed, a group whose campaign of terror led to hundreds and thousands of deaths.

item.title: Republicans and Democrats at an impasse as government shutdown enters sixth day
item.description: Republican and Democratic lawmakers have provided few public signs of meaningful negotiations to break an impasse on reopening the federal government ...

item.title: US Supreme Court rejects Ghislaine Maxwell appeal in Epstein case
item.description: The British socialite is serving a 20-year prison sentence on sex -trafficking charges related to former boyfriend Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: ICE ad blitz aims to lure local law enforcement officers to join Trump mass deportation efforts

item.title: Asahi restarts beer production after cyber-attack
item.description: Japan's biggest brewer has restarted six factories that produce its popular Super Dry beer.

item.title: Hurricane Priscilla intensifying off southwest Mexico. Maps show forecast path.
item.description: Priscilla strengthened into a hurricane Sunday and was getting stronger early Monday, forecasters said.

item.title: Government shutdown live updates as stalemate continues into second week
item.description: The 2025 government shutdown entered its sixth day on Monday with no signs of an imminent resolution. Follow live updates here.

item.title: Eswatini accepts 10 US deportees despite legal challenge
item.description: This is the second group to arrive in the southern Africa state following a deal with the US government.

item.title: France in fresh political crisis as PM Lecornu quits after 26 days
item.description: Lecornu criticised the "partisan appetites" of political factions, who he said had refused to compromise.
